title: Let's Talk META!
body:
So over the past few months complaints about the META have struck up again.
Sure this happens every time the META shifts and changes even a little bit, but this time we've got quite the change don't we?

Marksman/ADC is no longer the power house.
This started back with the Marksmen/ADC update. (Which laughably caused a lot of Youtubers/Streamers to quit League change to another game and the sudden change caused massive drop in their viewer base. That's another topic, but always a fun one to poke at since so many are salty over it)
Now the changes here were quite good, making certain champs stand out more in the crowd like Graves and his reload mechanic (later seen on Jhin) and we also saw the much needed nerf to Jinx, for a while this created quite a diversity in bot lane.
Unfortunately that didn't last long.

But now we have massive complaining everywhere that ADCs are being treated unfairly, they have no survival in this new Meta shift that has assassins being overbearing.
Are they though?

-----------------------------------

Let's take a look at the last Meta that people really bitched and moaned about, the oh so dreaded TANK META!
Was it really so bad?
I don't think so, though I might be a bit biased, I love Tanks.
In MMOs I typically play Tank or Healer, this was originally because DERPS have queue times of 30+ minutes in most MMOs, but I just came to love taking no damage or canceling out all damage my team have taken.
Now in League I feel that Tanks are underpowered, you can take a Rammus with 400 Armour and 5000 Health and he'll die in 2.5 seconds to most situations. (let's not even go where Vayne is for that scenario)

League of Legends is very much about counter play, most people think counter play is entirely a champion's kit.
But where I find counter play to be most effective is in your item build.
There are a lot of items in LoL that you can build to counter tanks, the most effective two are {{item:3153}} and {{item:3151}} .
Items and combination of items are very important.

Unfortunately there aren't as many item options for AP users when it comes to penetration as there is for AD users.
{{item:3151}} {{item:3135}} {{item:3020}} {{item:3001}}  vs {{item:3153}} {{item:3071}} {{item:3035}} {{item:3134}} (and the items those last two build into)
That's quite the difference, and the outcome of building some of these together can be drastically different. (I'd love to see Armour Penetration Boots)

Practically any AD champion can take a Blade of the Ruined King and utilise it pretty well, unfortunately it's counter part Liandry's Torment can't be used on as many AP champions.
This is another problem that items face here, how fitting they are to a champion and it's build and if the situation arises can you say "fuck it" and use it anyway.

Now something that annoyed me a lot during the moaning and whining of the Tank Meta was that anyone who complained acted as if these items didn't exist, hell many people complained that Vayne was banned nearly every game, despite there being plenty of ADCs/Marksmen who are capable of shredding tanks reliably. (if not as ridiculous as she does)
{{champion:29}} {{champion:203}} {{champion:96}} 
Kindred while currently considered underpowered at this point, can utilise {{item:3153}} and an armour pen item like {{item:3035}} to make any amount of armour on a tank just be worthless. And as a Jungle she has access to {{item:1419}} increasing her strength against tanks further, though most find {{item:1412}} to be better on her at times. (Warrior was certainly the best option on her back when it was armour pen)

Now looking at it like this shows that while people were complaining about the Tank Meta being boring and unfun, there were plenty of options to play against it and counter tanks.

Items are incredibly powerful in this game, they have the ability to turn a bad situation into a good one.
Most often when I see a Vlad{{champion:8}}  or Mundo{{champion:36}}  in a game I sigh in disappointment, most teams I get end up feeding these champions quite a lot.
Admittedly I've struggled against them from time to time quite a bit.
But then one of my old favourite items was added back into the game.
{{item:3123}} 
I fell in love with this item a second time when it returned, particularly on a day where I was playing Darius {{champion:122}} against Vlad {{champion:8}} .
I went 0/2 against him pretty quickly and he because unbearable, forcing me into tower and causing me to lose quite a lot of CS.
Upon buying my {{item:3123}} the lane turned around and Vlad ceased to exist the entire game, the sustain mage surprising can't do much when he can't sustain.

----------------------------------------

Now back to the current Meta.
Assassins are back, and for the first time since the game came out of Beta ADCs/Marksmen are not the dominant force in the game.
The game is no longer centered on the ADC, no longer centered on the bot lane.
So of course, bitching must occur!
ADCs are getting killed so quickly that Supports are complaining they can't shield/heal/etc faster enough.

So maybe the ADCs should do something and change to fit the Meta instead of complaining?

When I play ADC I like to take to {{summoner:3}} I've been doing this for years.
I never seem to use {{summoner:7}} {{summoner:21}} at the right times, and I just don't really like taking {{summoner:14}} especially if there are items that do it's job better.
{{summoner:3}}  however is incredible, it might do TOO MUCH all at once, it slows attack and move speed, it shreds armour and magic resist by 10 points and reduces damage output by 40%.
In my eyes, that is incredible for an ADC to have, the dueling potential it gives, and the survival it brings against assassins is incredible.

Items are interesting here as well.
In the same way there are items to deal with tanks, there are items that protect you, especially against assassins.

The first that comes to mind for some people is {{item:3140}} {{item:3139}} unfortunately it was nerfed pretty hard last year, which was a major buff for Zed {{champion:238}}  and Fizz {{champion:105}} .
It was quite a sad nerf, as a Jungle main I found myself using {{item:3139}} quite a fair bit if I could fit it, now it's rarely that efficient to spend gold on, especially with the high cost of {{item:3140}} and the combination cost for the final item.

Now for ADCs we still do have a gold efficient item combo that can give incredible survival, especially against assassins.
{{item:3046}} {{item:3812}} 
These two items give great defensive and offensive bonuses to you.
Death's Dance slows down burst damage against you, while Phantom Dancer reduces damage taken from the opponent you are engaged to.

On top of this, it's important to TRY DIFFERENT THINGS.
Especially different combinations.

There is no progress to be made by playing the same thing every game and then just bitching that it doesn't work.

Having trouble against Rengar {{champion:107}} ?
Did you know that Rengar players rage quit out of frustration against Vayne {{champion:67}} Janna {{champion:40}} combos?
Vayne and Janna just out right trash Rengar and most assassin's engage, if an assassin's engage is negated they wont do much damage afterwards.
For instance Rengar has no way to re-engage without a bush or his ult, if his leap is thwarted he dies quickly.

Change who you are playing.
Change your build.


Buying {{item:3085}} every game on Caitlyn {{champion:51}} wont change the Meta, it wont change how quickly you are going POOF to Zed{{champion:238}} .
But if you think creatively, pick someone else, look at a different build, you'll make the best of the situation.

Urgot {{champion:6}} is still a Marksman, he's tanky as all hell, with inbuilt armour shred and a slows for days with locking missiles.
Is Urgot sleeper OP? I know I can go 20/0 on him.


----------------------

What do you think?

replies.body:
Representation of current meta

"What is an adc but an easy kill"

Nerf all other role and items, buff support items to op status

Bring on the support meta

I think ADC's like to bitch a lot about the 4 man ganks bot lane usually pre- level 6 XD. That can either go incredibly well for the gankers, or very well (if you counter play just right) for the persons being ganked. >_<
It can give massive leads to whomever comes out on top, and usually the losing team wont be strong enough mid game to perform proper team fights :P.

Also AD assasins are easy to deal with, its the AP ones that you gotta watch out for!

AND also, why do juggernauts exit? ;_; plz rito, you're either tanky or bruiser. NOT BOTH!!!

I find alot of adcs have trouble with ad assasins, specifically the stealth ones. Shaco, Khazix, Rengar, good or bad, even if the player sucks if the person playing these champions wants to the adc dead, they're going to be dead, regardless of peel. I play a bit of shaco and sometimes khazix (though I'm a long way from getting the hang of kha) and I'm not great but I usually find that there isn't much the enemy adc can do against me.

The issue is you can itemize against an AP threat easily (scimitar, Maw etc.), you can't itemize for AD damage without building something extremely out of your build, the main thing you see built for against AD is GA, because if your going Armor, that's about the only thing you can go.

Well, if you have hybrid ratios you could go Zhonias or if you are ezreal you could use Iceborn Gauntlet, personally if I'm getting wrecked by an ad assassin, especially those with crit, like say a shaco (prerework), vayne or yasou, I might stick a Randuins in my build over GA and the slow from randuins can often help get an ad assassin off my tail once I flash away. Recently I've been considering whether ohmwrecker/zzrot would be decent on an Adc because the statline isn't too bad defensively and the active could help you rush towers and the pointrunner movespeed would help you stay in kiting out the bruisers.

But I agree that itemisation against Ad is pretty abysmal at the moment. I mean I can understand why, it's the same reason why abyssal is pretty much the only magic resist option for Ap midlaners, it's too stop defensive itemisation in damage roles but I think it's high time adcs got something, or at least an item to deal with sticky melee assassins that isn't a goddamn Randuins.

The issue isn't tanks (because juggernaut's are a different issue) existing (Maybe minus the fact that poppy is OP as fuck, and colossus still needs nerfs) it's the fact that AD's don't have a nice hybrid defense/offense item against AD damage, and the best bet to stay in build is health.

I stopped reading part way through to just address the ADC meta issue.

The issue that ADC's have is that they realistically need 3-4 items to be useful, and with such an accelerated meta, there is just no way they can do that, and it means they are almost always giving up an item for survivability to actually do damage (because your picking between survivability item and the last whisper items)

There are some champions that can get away with less items and still do decent, but the majority just can't, which has just caused the issues we have.

And in comes Ziggs, doing the pushing that ADC's have to do, but needing less items, and spiking sooner, and right now, he is the perfect ADC replacement until the meta slows down.

Or go for {{item:3071}} against bursty ad assassins, {{item:3022}} against bruisers, {{item:3814}} against bursty mages, {{item:3156}} against kinda bursty but more dps mages, {{item:3072}} generally and for lifesteal, {{item:3139}} against cc, {{item:3153}} against tanks that somehow just got too big, {{item:3142}} also against tanks but also just good for chasing or running away, {{item:3053}} for adcs who use spellblades and scale off total ad and not bonus ad, also not a horrible item on high atkspeed champions, {{item:3026}} if you are really getting desperate against a really fed burst assassin. {{item:3157}} basically GA but feels better if you have ap ratios.

well I mean I once saw a tristana build {{item:3022}}{{item:3071}} {{item:3065}} {{item:3143}} {{item:3026}}{{item:3006}}   into an enemy team that had a rengar, yasou and fizz and she didn't do that badly. It's a little defensive for my taste but it worked and maybe tank marksmen is just something that needs to be explored to make adcs relevant in season 7.

Also, you'd be surprised how well BoRK+Deaths Dance/Bloodthirster+Spirit Visage works on alot of adcs.

I suspect this will be a thing soon. Maybe the idea is to make assassins assassins and make AD's less burst and more chunk.

Always liked the kite potential of mallet on ADCs.

PD has no argument because it's basically the other end of Shiv, and doesn't really help when 2 people dive you, Death's Dance you also don't, as it's the survivability class of item i was talking about, and you have to give up last whisper for a bit to get it, and that's just not useful.

Also if your AA heavy Death's Dance does nothing better then BT.

EDIT: I think i'll give you an example to show what i mean.

Ezreal spikes decently at 2 items (Sheen item, and Manamune) but he still from here needs to build a survivability item and a last whisper item, meaning while he spikes at 2, he becomes an actual issue for the enemy team at 4, and ezreal is one of the few champions that spike at 2 instead of 3, you'll find that a lot more ADC's, especially the hyper carries, spike at 3, meaning they are never going to have the gold to become relevant before late game, which most times the only reason a late game exists, is because it's turned into a clown fiesta due to the enemy team not knowing how to end it properly.

Which is again, why Zigg's is good, because he can itemize defensive so easily, and doesn't necessarily need the heavy pen items because he spikes so early (as he is less item dependant and more level dependant) meaning he can basically itemize for tower pushing.

I have to say, this seems like a well constructed and thought out post. Good job Klavin, take my upvote.

Now onto the issue at hand:

One of the major issues I've noticed (and I must admit I'm guilty of this a bit myself) is that ADCs always seem to build "glass cannon", ignoring the need for any kind of defensive stats. It's not like the options don't exist, but people just seem to be flat out ignoring them because "damage wins games". That's not much use in an Assassin META, though. If you're not building *any* defensive stats, you're just going to get demolished by anyone that can reliably engage and burst or poke you down from a distance, and may even get out-damaged by Tanks (I've seen this happen a lot).

With ADCs building glass cannon, that means the Supports can't do their usual jobs because their ADCs are dead before they're able to react. With some defensive stats on those ADCs, they'll be a lot more likely to survive long enough for the Support to be useful and, hopefully, turn the tides of battle. When it comes down to it, people just need to stop b!tching, look at the things that are getting them killed all the time and formulate strategies that can help them overcome those obstacles.

But of course, that's not going to happen, because it's a lot easier to blame someone else (*cough* Riot *cough*) than to reflect on what you are doing wrong and work to improve yourself.

Whats this shit? Assassins are under bearing as a class atm. Thus their buffs next patch.

And yes tanks may die in 2.5 seconds, but more often then not they end up dishing out way more damage than a tank should anyway.

And you can't complain abut rengar until he can kill a lv1 teemo sitting in fountain. His q is easily avoidable and its cast is really slow.
